Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice including part of handle zone; white slip; interior: glazed black with two narrow bands in added white; exterior: painted decoration consisting of foreleg of animal to left; part of rising roundel as filling ornament; below, part of large maeander pattern in handle zone; at right, tongue pattern around handle root.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 265, no. 570, pl. 72)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0622) (phase 2)
